description: This course is an introduction to PPE, an interdisciplinary field that pursues the powerful
connections among its three defining disciplines (philosophy, politics, and economics). Students
engage with core topics in the field - such as markets, collective action, justice, and public
choice - from a variety of ideological perspectives, such as libertarianism, Marxism, liberalism,
and feminism. They learn how to integrate different disciplinary approaches in application to both
theoretical and policy debates. Not open to first-year students except by special permission.
fullname: Introduction to PPE (Philosophy, Politics, and Economics)
